content: The "Systemic Risk Designation Improvement Act of 2013" amends the table of contents for the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act by adding a new section 113 regarding enhanced supervision and regulation of certain nonbank financial companies and bank holding companies. The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to include enhanced supervision and regulation of certain nonbank financial companies and bank holding companies. The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to include enhanced supervision and prudential standards for bank holding companies that pose a threat to the financial stability of the United States. The Dodd-Frank Act amends to include enhanced supervision and prudential standards for bank holding companies that could threaten the financial stability of the United States. The Council will use an indicator-based measurement approach to consider the size, interconnectedness, substitutes availability, global activity, and complexity of the bank holding company. The Dodd-Frank Act amends to include enhanced supervision and prudential standards for bank holding companies that could threaten the financial stability of the United States. The Council will use an indicator-based measurement approach to consider the size, interconnectedness, substitutes availability, global activity, and complexity of the bank holding company. In subsections (e) through (j), amendments are made to include subsection (c) and replace "nonbank financial company" with "bank holding." The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to enhance supervision for bank holding companies. Changes include replacing "nonbank financial company" with "bank holding" in various subsections. The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to enhance supervision for bank holding companies by making changes to subsections (a)(1), (a)(2), and (b)(3) of section 115. The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to expand supervision for bank holding companies by modifying sections 116(a) and 121, requiring final determinations under section 113 for affected institutions. The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to expand supervision for bank holding companies by requiring final determinations under section 113 for affected institutions. Section 155 is also amended to include institutions subject to section 113 in the Office of Financial Research. The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to expand supervision for bank holding companies by requiring final determinations under section 113 for affected institutions. This includes changes to acquisitions, management interlocks, and enhanced supervision and prudential standards for institutions meeting certain criteria. The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to expand supervision for bank holding companies by requiring final determinations under section 113 for affected institutions, removing asset thresholds and adjusting subsections accordingly.
